H0.text: Both are tall is evidence that donkeys and horses are related, according to scientists who claim the two organisms share a common ancestor.

H1.text: Both run fast is evidence that donkeys and horses share a common ancestor, according to scientists.

H2.text: They have the same diet is evidence that, according to scientists, donkeys and horses share a common ancestor and are related.

H3.text: They have the same bones in their limbs, evidence that donkeys and horses are related as they share a common ancestor according to scientists.

A4.text: The most recent common ancestor of all modern equines lived ~5.6 (3.9-7.8) Mya.

A6.text: They were herbivorous browsers on relatively soft plants, and already adapted for running.

A7.text: They have evolved specialized teeth that cut and shear tough plant matter to accommodate their fibrous diet.
